info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON... NORTHEASTERN CLARION AND SOUTHEASTERN FOREST COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marienville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Marienville, Sigel, Fryburg, Fisher, Leeper, Clarington, Clear Creek State Park, and Cook Forest State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern and west central Pennsylvania.
